subject: Business
title: Choice Overload: When More Is Less
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Choice Overload: When More Is Less.

hook.text: A supermarket offered 24 jams for tasting. Only 3% bought. With 6 jams, 30% bought. Fewer options, more sales.

buildup.text: Sheena Iyengar's jam study proved that too many options paralyze decision-making.

discovery.text: When choices overwhelm us, we defer the decision ‚Äî which often means buying nothing at all.

twist.text: Yet consumers say they want more options. They prefer the idea of choice more than the reality of choosing.

climax.text: Apple offers a few products. Amazon offers millions but curates with 'Best Sellers' and 'Amazon's Choice.'

punchline.text: Don't offer everything. Curate the best few.

quiz.question: What did the jam study demonstrate?
options: Too many options paralyze decisions and reduce purchases
Expensive jams sell better than cheap ones
